eadid.publicid: -//David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library//TEXT (US::NcD::James Garfield collection, 1880-1906 //EN

titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the James Garfield collection, 1880-1906
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, May 2019

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Collection contains two letters of recommendation by Garfield for office seekers; an 1881 invitation to Garfield's inaugural ball; a facsimile of an 1880 letter from Garfield to Marshall Jewel, chairman of the Republican National Committee, denouncing as a forgery the Morey letter concerning Chinese immigration; an 1882 announcement of a memorial service in Garfield's honor; a certificate issued to J. A. Brookshier, a contributing member of the Garfield National Masonic Memorial Association of Washington, D.C.; and typescripts of two speeches, approximately 1899 and 1906, delivered by an unknown alumnus of Hiram College and containing reminiscences of classmate James A. Garfield.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: James Garfield collection, 1880-1906, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, May 2019.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Cataloged from Guide and accession records.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains two letters of recommendation by Garfield for office seekers; an 1881 invitation to Garfield's inaugural ball; a facsimile of an 1880 letter from Garfield to Marshall Jewel, chairman of the Republican National Committee, denouncing as a forgery the Morey letter concerning Chinese immigration; an 1882 announcement of a memorial service in Garfield's honor; a certificate issued to J. A. Brookshier, a contributing member of the Garfield National Masonic Memorial Association of Washington, D.C.; and typescripts of two speeches, approximately 1899 and 1906, delivered by an unknown alumnus of Hiram College and containing reminiscences of classmate James A. Garfield.
